Do you understand price of this change? "ping" will not be able to see issues with ingress flow rules (it is already can't see issues in egress rules). So only transit rules are verified.
If you make a decision on transit encapsulation type - you must process all existing and not existing(trigger apropriate error) types.
Totally unreadable. You fill only one field and name all other as "reserved"... ugly. Without VxLan packet schema somewhere in front of eyes this code is not modifiable.
We verify this when creating requests for installing switch rules. Therefore, I think that there may be cases when this check is needed.
